author: Jay Bonggolto
title: You can now tell Google Assistant to shut up on Nest devices in a snap
description:
There's no need to say "Hey Google" first.

What you need to know


Google Assistant has picked up a new feature that lets you make it stop speaking immediately without using a hotword.
The "stop" quick command is available only on Assistant-enabled smart dis…

author: Mike Murphy
title: : Pelosi now says she’s open to banning stock trades by members of Congress
description: In a reversal from previous comments, House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said Thursday she was open to banning stock trades by members of Congress.

author: Steve Goldstein
title: : Here’s why a star fund manager just sold his entire stake in Amazon.com
description: Amazon.com has been a holding for four years in the Blue Whale Growth fund, one of the highest-profile U.K. funds that invests in U.S. companies. No longer.

author: Victor Reklaitis
title: Washington Watch: Amazon, Facebook set Washington lobbying spending records
description: Amazon.com with its subsidiaries and Facebook's parent company set records in their spending on Washington lobbying last year, according to new disclosures.

author: Chris Matthews
title: : Pelosi’s husband bought Google, Disney call options that would pay off if bull market continues
description: U.S. House Speaker Nancy Pelosi's husband appears to be positioning himself to profit from the continued rise in the share prices of some of America's biggest companies.

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Zoom is returning to the office, but most workers aren’t coming back
description: Only 2% of Zoom’s workforce go to an office every day, while rest of videoconferencing company’s staff are expected to work remotely full- or part-time

title: : The highest-paid job in America pays $200,000 — and the number of job openings are growing
description: This analysis is based on median salary and the number of salary reports.

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Senate panel approves antitrust bill targeting Apple, Google and Amazon
description: The Senate Judiciary Committee on Thursday overwhelmingly passed antitrust legislation barring tech's biggest platforms from favoring their products and services over competitors, taking aim at Apple Inc., Google parent Alphabet Inc. and Amazon.com Inc.

author: Dividend Sensei
title: Buy Alphabet Now Before Everyone Else Does
description: Alphabet remains a classic Buffett-style "wonderful company at a fair price", offering 19% long-term return potential. See why we think you can safely buy GOOG.

title: : Microsoft makes a bullish move to buy Activision as tech investors run for cover
description: The software and cloud company steps firmly into the consumer space with its proposed purchase of the videogame maker.

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Amazon has mostly avoided antitrust scrutiny, but that may change in 2022
description: Congress and the Federal Trade Commission have Amazon in their collective crosshairs entering 2022. While new bills target Amazon's online-sales practices, a longtime antagonist sits atop the FTC as it decides how to best keep the e-commerce leader in check.

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Microsoft has avoided U.S. antitrust scrutiny, but Europe is a different matter
description: After withstanding its own antitrust battle in the dot-com era, Microsoft has pointed fingers at rivals and largely avoided recriminations in the current round of regulator scrutiny, but the relative quiet may not last through 2022

title: : Some hardy souls are determined to attend CES despite surge in omicron

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Google and Facebook CEOs colluded in online-ad sales scheme, unredacted antitrust lawsuit alleges
description: Google hoodwinked advertisers and publishers for years on pricing of its ad auctions, then pocketed the difference and used the resulting pool of money to manipulate future auctions to expand its digital monopoly, according to newly unredacted details Friday …

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Google enters 2022 battling antitrust actions on multiple fronts — with more likely to come
description: Google parent Alphabet Inc. is in the hottest of hot seats as the antitrust spotlight intensifies on Big Tech, with multiple actions expected to come to a head in 2022.

author: Jon Swartz
title: : Senate members say tech regulation is among their agenda items in 2022: CES
description: The tech industry can expect a busy --- and at times, confrontational --- dance with Capitol Hill this year on everything from child protection and advanced manufacturing in the U.S. to closing the digital divide and enhancing STEM education.

author: Christine Idzelis
title: The Tell: Worried about a bubble? Why you should overweight U.S. equities this year, according to Goldman Sachs
description: Investors should favor U.S. equities this year even as valuations are historically high and the Federal Reserve moves toward tightening its monetary policy, according to the investment strategy group at Goldman Sachs.
